snippet: The so-called Heartland virus, never seen before, is the apparent cause of severe illness in two Missouri men who were bitten by ticks.
abstract: Dr Scott M Folk and Dr Laura K McMullan study in the New England Journal of Medicine reports on the Heartland virus, aggressive phlebovirus identified in two Missouri men who were bitten by ticks; virus may be an alarming addition to the list of tick-borne dangers that includes Lyme disease, babesiosis, Rocky Mountain spotted fever and ehrlichiosis.
lead_paragraph: The so-called Heartland virus, never seen before, is the apparent cause of severe illness in two Missouri men who were bitten by ticks.

headline.seo: New Tick-Borne Heartland Virus Has Scientists Puzzled
headline.main: New Virus Tied to Ticks Poses Puzzle for Doctors
headline.print_headline: New Virus Tied to Ticks Poses Puzzle For Doctors
